===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|むな}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=むな}}. Possibly the original form of ''mune'' below.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

Cognate with {{m|ja|棟|tr=muna||main roofline, roof ridge}}, from the underlying idea of ''central or main portion''.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

Possibly also cognate with {{m|ja|空}}, {{m|ja|虚|tr=muna||emptiness, void}}, from the idea of ''cavity''.

Seldom used in isolation even in {{etyl|ojp|-}}. Only found as the first element of compounds in modern Japanese.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|むね|yomi=k}}
Sound shift from ''muna'' above, from the fusion of ''muna'' with the emphatic nominal particle {{m|ja|い|tr=i}}: {{IPAchar|/muna i/}} → {{IPAchar|/mune/}}. Similar to the phonetic process observed in the shift from {{m|ja|神|tr=kamu||spirit, god|pos=older form used in compounds}} to {{m|ja|神|tr=kami|pos=newer form, used as a standalone noun}}.

Alternatively, may be a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=むね|身|tr1=mu|t1=body|根|tr2=ne|t2=root}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

Cognate with {{m|ja|棟|tr=mune||main roofline, roof ridge}} and {{m|ja|宗}}, {{m|ja|旨|tr=mune||gist, main idea, primary part}}, from the underlying idea of ''central or main portion''.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

Notably, {{m|ja|棟}} and {{m|ja|宗}} also have an older reading ''muna'' that is only used in compounds (for {{m|ja|宗}}, possibly only in place names). Meanwhile, {{m|ja|旨|tr=mune}} appears later in the textual record (in the ''[[w:Uji_Shūi_Monogatari|Uji Shūi Monogatari]]'' of the early 1200s), and this reading is used as a standalone noun rather than in compounds. This is consistent with other nouns that have paired vowel forms, and suggests that ''muna'' is probably the original form, and that the compound derivation is a [[folk etymology]].
